result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

8:32 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: B Harris, Defendant Joseph Jerome Zappa Jr in court. Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions DE regarding attorney status.  DE states PFAC is filled out requesting to have Atty appointed. Court approves and signs OACL, starts DE on payment plan commencing 8/1/22 at $50 per month. DE to appear in person for next hearing.  DE confirms address and updates cell phone. CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Michelle P Brekken. Joseph Jerome Zappa pro se via phone. Case called at 10:47 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for a status conference to check on counsel. Court questions why not in person. DE states vehicle is not working. Was told by someone Atty Selmer was appointed. Clerk checks with JA. After confirming with JA, no PFAC. Court schedules for next week. DE needs to be present in person with PFAC completed. Court adjourned at 10:56 a.m.  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on June 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Michelle P Brekken. Joseph Jerome Zappa pro se. Case called at 9:34 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for an attorney status check. DE did not qualify for PD services. Did not file PFAC. DE is unsure what to do. DE has PFAC application. Court directs DE to file today after court. ADA Brekken states at initial appearance, DE was ordered to appear to JSC for baseline testing. Did not appear. Court orders DE to report for testing today after Court. Representative from JSC is present and will direct him. ADA Brekken states DE is requesting cell phone be returned. Currently there is a possible extraction taking place. Court directs DE to inquire at next date. Court adjourned at 9:38 a.m.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.
